## Predicting the DV {.smaller}
::: {.incremental}
- The dependent variable (DV) varies
- We try to recreate/predict the observed DV values by looking at predictor variables
    - [Predicting with dummies (one-way)](https://johnnydoorn.github.io/statistics-lectures/courses/SSR/SSR_2023-2024/MiscFiles_J/PredictingWithDummies.html)
    - [Predicting with dummies (factorial)](https://johnnydoorn.github.io/statistics-lectures/courses/SSR/SSR_2023-2024/MiscFiles_J/PredictingWithDummies_Interaction.html)
    - [Visual prediction in RM ANOVA](https://statisticalreasoning-uva-2.shinyapps.io/RM_ANOVA/)
- Accurate approximation/prediction of the DV? -> high explained variance
- Total variability of DV = explained variance + unexplained variance
    - $\text{DV} = \text{model prediction} + \text{error}$
- More explained variance than unexplained variance (e.g., $F >> 1$) -> success!
:::
